Can you explain why upgrading to a quantum secure address will only secure the latest 100 transactions sent to my identity name/address?

Actually, upgrading to a quantum secure address will retroactively secure **all** transactions sent to your identity name/address, not just the latest 100. This means that if you have 1000 transactions sent to your identity, the upgrade will secure all 1000 of them.

s as well. That means that if you have 1000 transactions sent to your identity name/address, an upgrade to a quantum secure address, when they are available, will retroactively secure all 1000 transactions under the control of that address.
Will I need to manually re-secure each of my previous transactions when I upgrade to a quantum secure address?

No, you won't need to manually re-secure each of your previous transactions. Upgrading to a quantum secure address will retroactively secure all previous transactions sent to your identity name/address, so you won't need to take any additional steps to secure them.

s as well. That means that if you have 1000 transactions sent to your identity name/address, an upgrade to a quantum secure address, when they are available, will retroactively secure all 1000 transactions under the control of that address.
